intro: Lepidagathis lanatoglabra, commonly known as the woolly lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a dense layer of fine pubescence. Lepidagathis lanatoglabra is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
